meanings.definition: A promontory or headland jutting out into the sea.
meanings.sent1: The foreland was a rocky cliff that extended into the ocean.
meanings.sent2: The sailors navigated around the foreland to reach the safety of the harbor.
meanings.sent3: The seagulls perched on the foreland, enjoying the view of the vast sea.
meanings.sent4: The foreland stood like a guardian, protecting the ships from the rough waves.
meanings.sent5: The crashing waves echoed against the foreland, creating a mesmerizing sound.

meanings.definition: The land that lies before or in front of something.
meanings.sent1: The lush green foreland stretched out in front of the majestic mountains.
meanings.sent2: The path through the forest led to a beautiful foreland with wildflowers.
meanings.sent3: The picnic spot was set up on the foreland, offering a scenic view of the valley.
meanings.sent4: The foreland acted as a welcoming entrance to the peaceful meadow beyond.
meanings.sent5: The setting sun cast a warm glow over the foreland, painting it in golden hues.
